<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/europe-discussing-plans-reopen-shuttered-tourism-sector?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Europe's Operation Fanny Pack Is a Go
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="747 plane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85NTUvNzQ3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While it's still annoying to hear your neighbors talk about that time they “summered in Capri,” Europe really wants them to come back. To make sure that happens sooner rather than 2030, the EU laid out a series of <a href="https://apnews.com/83ac6760ca768325a8a8ad39adecb5cf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guidelines</a> yesterday that chart a path toward reviving the shuttered tourism industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like Ricky Bobby and “going fast,” tourism and Europe need each other.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tourism accounts for nearly 10% of the continent's GDP.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Europe accounts for 50% of the global tourism industry, in terms of international arrivals.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But unlike AirPods... </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The tourism plan isn’t one-size-fits-all. According to the EU, countries with "sufficiently similar epidemiological situations," should <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/may/12/eu-reopen-borders-tourists-covid-19-recovery-plan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coordinate with each other first</a>. Germany and Austria seem ready to relax border controls this weekend. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>This piecemeal reopening effort will show the rest of the tourism industry what checking “for pleasure” on customs forms might look like in a world reshaped by the coronavirus. You'll see...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">More</strong></h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bubbles:</strong></span><span> Specific “travel bubbles” would allow the countries with the lowest infection rates to reopen their most popular destinations, even if broader travel restrictions remain. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Scheduling: </strong></span><span>Like late-semester office hours, visitors will have to sign up for </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/13/face-masks-and-swimming-pool-bookings-how-europe-is-reopening-tourism.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">specific time slots</a></span><span> in order to eat dinner or jump in the pool to help resorts manage crowds. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Flexibility: </strong></span><span>The EU is recommending operators offer customers more flexible choices between reimbursements and vouchers to entice travelers to...travel. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Fewer</strong></h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Americans:</strong></span><span> The EU is still recommending its members </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/europe-summer-coronavirus-tourism/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ban visitors</a></span><span> from non-EU countries for at least another month. But with infection rates continuing to drop, those rules could soon change. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Extra pairs of underwear</strong></span><span>: The EU suggests airlines limit the amount of baggage travelers can bring on board as well as overall contact with the flight crew. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With international arrivals to Europe expected to fall by <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-threatens-southern-europes-vital-tourism-industry-11587646723?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">40% this year</a>, governments are navigating the delicate give-and-take between restarting Eiffel Tower tours and keeping a lid on new infections. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/powell-urges-congress-step-stimulus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jerome Powell to Congress:
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Powell meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85NDkvcG93ZWxsX21lbWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Neal Freyman</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fed Chair Jerome Powell warned the U.S. economy could be left with some <a href="https://apnews.com/5d02177563bdb72236966a13299c0b67?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nasty scars</a> unless the government steps in with more emergency aid.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaking at a virtual event hosted by the Peterson Institute for International Economics yesterday, Powell acknowledged that “additional fiscal support could be costly, but worth it if it helps avoid long-term economic damage and leaves us with a stronger recovery.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How costly? The government has already poured in about $3 trillion to keep the economy afloat, and this week House Democrats unveiled a relief package worth $3 trillion more.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But Powell said </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/fed-jerome-powell-coronavirus-spending-e71d88c5-09ec-4410-b08f-3d4ad6304db0.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concerns about spending</a></span><span> shouldn’t be a priority right now. After all, of people making less than $40k a year employed in February, 40% lost their jobs in March. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Powell said if you squint real hard (and provide enough relief), you can see the yellow brick road back to 3.5% unemployment. “I have every reason to think we should get back there.”</p>

<tr>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/haven-ceo-atul-gawande-steps?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
CEO Job Didn’t Haven the Right Feel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Haven <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/05/13/gawande-leaving-haven-ceo-job-to-focus-on-covid19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> Atul Gawande will step down after two years as CEO but will stay on as the company’s chairman. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s Haven? </strong>A healthcare company launched in 2018 as a joint venture between JPMorgan, Amazon, and Berkshire Hathaway. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Haven's official goal is to improve U.S. healthcare, and...it's got a long way to go. So far, it's offered some JPMorgan employees deductible-free health plans with wellness incentives, but it’s kept a low profile to keep its edge in a competitive sector. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s Atul Gawande? </strong>Both a doctor and a prolific writer. News of him stepping down came out just as he published a <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/science/medical-dispatch/amid-the-coronavirus-crisis-a-regimen-for-reentry?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new article</a> in the New Yorker about how to safely lift coronavirus lockdown restrictions. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gawande said his role at Haven would shift from day-to-day concerns to broader strategy and leadership. COO and former CVS exec Mitch Betses will run the show for the time being. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This isn’t Haven’s first exexit. Former COO Jack Stoddard left last May after just eight months.</p>

They have a full suite of offerings that includes <strong style="color:#000">investing, banking, guidance, and of course, trading</strong>. Now, we’re no experts (which is totally cool with <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23895781.271239709;dc_trk_aid=467297864;dc_trk_cid=132091411;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">E*TRADE</a>) but we think that’s pretty much all the money things. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Having an asset (money term, nice) like <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N84001.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23895781.271239709;dc_trk_aid=467297864;dc_trk_cid=132091411;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">E*TRADE</a> at our fingertips has made it easier to put our money to work.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/pandemicfueled-meat-industry-woes-boost-alternative-meat?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fake Meat Has Real Momentum
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Burger " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MzMvYnVyZ2VyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic has exposed the traditional meat industry’s weak spots—namely, preventing outbreaks among workers. The difficulty of keeping slaughterhouses functioning safely has led to plant shutdowns, which themselves have led to spikes in wholesale prices. Meanwhile, alternative meat is <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/edf2db2f-bbcc-42f2-8aa4-233c0c46b4c6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gaining ground</a> on two fronts. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No. 1: It's picking up the grocery pace. </strong>The sector’s U.S. retail sales grew 265% in the eight weeks leading up to mid-April, according to Nielsen, compared to 39% for fresh meat. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No. 2: Alt-meat is riding a huge funding wave. </strong>At $930 million, Q1 investments in alt-meat companies <a href="https://www.gfi.org/blog-state-of-the-industry-2020?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=blog-state-of-the-industry-2020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topped</a> 2019’s <em>total</em> fundraising haul (yes, including Beyond Meat’s $250 million IPO), per alt-protein lobbying firm the Good Food Institute. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plant-based meat company Impossible Foods raised $500 million, while media/alt-food brand LiveKindly pulled in $200 million. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> While some of this momentum is driven by the pandemic, a Berenberg analyst told the Financial Times that broad consumer trends toward environmentalism, healthy eating, and animal welfare will likely keep buoying the alt-meat sector.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/13/epic-games-releases-next-generation-graphic-engine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Contained in This Picture: 16 Billion Triangles
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Realistic video game statues " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85NTQvcmVhbGlzdGljX3N0YXR1ZXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Epic Games</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Epic Games, maker of <em>Fortnite</em>, released fresh details about its latest game engine, <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/13/21256079/epic-unreal-engine-5-playstation-5-demo-next-gen-graphics-release-date?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Unreal Engine 5</a>, yesterday. The screenshot above was taken from a demo game showcasing the engine on a PlayStation 5. Yep, it's pretty ridiculous. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unreal Engine 5 is Epic's most powerful engine yet, allowing video game developers and filmmakers to create hyperrealistic representations of real-life surfaces, at a fraction of the time and money. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The hardest problem in game development right now is building high quality games...so we want to make developers’ lives easier and more productive," Epic CEO Tim Sweeney told The Verge. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sweeney, unsurprisingly, is a <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/epic-games-ceo-tim-sweeney-fortnite-unreal-engine-2019-3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">huge proponent</a> of the migration toward <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/virtual-worlds-stay?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual worlds</a> and the "<a href="https://www.matthewball.vc/all/themetaverse?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">metaverse</a>." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> With graphics like those, we're with Tim.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here...</strong>Sony said the PS5 should be ready to ship for the 2020 holiday season. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Listen, we went to Mont-Tremblant last winter—it was extremely pleasant and we'd like to go back sometime. <ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Canada’s largest city by population.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The smallest Canadian province by land area.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Canada's national dish.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Canada has more of these geographic features than anywhere else in the world.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Complete this phrase from the Canadian National Anthem: “With glowing hearts we see thee rise, the _______ strong and free!</span></li>
</ol>

about that time they “summered in Capri,” Europe really wants them to come back. To make sure that happens sooner rather than 2030, the EU laid out a series of \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/83ac6760ca768325a8a8ad39adecb5cf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eguidelines\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that chart a path toward reviving the shuttered tourism industry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike Ricky Bobby and “going fast,” tourism and Europe need each other.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTourism accounts for nearly 10% of the continent's GDP.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEurope accounts for 50% of the global tourism industry, in terms of international arrivals.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut unlike AirPods... \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe tourism plan isn’t one-size-fits-all. According to the EU, countries with \"sufficiently similar epidemiological situations,\" should \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/may/12/eu-reopen-borders-tourists-covid-19-recovery-plan?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecoordinate with each other first\u003c/a\u003e. Germany and Austria seem ready to relax border controls this weekend. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThis piecemeal reopening effort will show the rest of the tourism industry what checking “for pleasure” on customs forms might look like in a world reshaped by the coronavirus. sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBubbles:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Specific “travel bubbles” would allow the countries with the lowest infection rates to reopen their most popular destinations, even if broader travel restrictions remain. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eScheduling: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLike late-semester office hours, visitors will have to sign up for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/13/face-masks-and-swimming-pool-bookings-how-europe-is-reopening-tourism.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003especific time slots\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in order to eat dinner or jump in the pool to help style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFlexibility: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe EU is recommending operators offer customers more flexible choices between reimbursements and vouchers to sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/europe-summer-coronavirus-tourism/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eban visitors\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from non-EU countries for at least another month. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85NDkvcG93ZWxsX21lbWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNeal Freyman\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFed Chair Jerome Powell warned the U.S. economy could be left with some \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/5d02177563bdb72236966a13299c0b67?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enasty scars\u003c/a\u003e unless the government steps in with more emergency aid.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpeaking at a virtual event hosted by the Peterson Institute for International Economics yesterday, Powell acknowledged that “additional fiscal support could be costly, but worth it if it helps avoid long-term economic damage and leaves us with a stronger recovery.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHow costly? The government has already poured in about $3 trillion to keep the economy afloat, and this week House Democrats unveiled a relief package worth $3 trillion more.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut Powell said \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/fed-jerome-powell-coronavirus-spending-e71d88c5-09ec-4410-b08f-3d4ad6304db0.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcerns about spending\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e shouldn’t be a priority right now. After all, of people making less than $40k a year employed in February, 40% lost their jobs in March. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ePowell said if you squint real hard (and provide enough relief), you can see the yellow brick road back to 3.5% unemployment. “I have every reason to think we should get back there.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s Haven? \u003c/strong\u003eA healthcare company launched in 2018 as a joint venture between style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHaven's official goal is to improve U.S. healthcare, and...it's got a long way to go. So far, it's offered some JPMorgan employees deductible-free health plans with wellness incentives, but it’s kept a low profile to keep its edge in a competitive sector. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s Atul Gawande? \u003c/strong\u003eBoth a doctor and a prolific writer. News of him stepping down came out just as he published a \u003ca href=\"https://www.newyorker.com/science/medical-dispatch/amid-the-coronavirus-crisis-a-regimen-for-reentry?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew article\u003c/a\u003e in the New Yorker about how to safely lift coronavirus lockdown restrictions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGawande said his role at Haven would shift from day-to-day concerns to broader strategy and leadership. COO and former CVS exec Mitch Betses will run the show for the time being. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis isn’t Haven’s first exexit. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe other day we were \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003ewaiting for inspiration to strike\u003c/span\u003e The difficulty of keeping slaughterhouses functioning safely has led to plant shutdowns, which themselves have led to spikes in wholesale prices. Meanwhile, alternative meat is \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/edf2db2f-bbcc-42f2-8aa4-233c0c46b4c6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egaining ground\u003c/a\u003e on two fronts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo. 1: It's picking up the grocery pace. \u003c/strong\u003eThe sector’s U.S. retail sales grew 265% in the eight weeks leading up to mid-April, according to Nielsen, compared to 39% for fresh meat. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo. 2: Alt-meat is riding a huge funding wave. \u003c/strong\u003eAt $930 million, Q1 investments in alt-meat companies \u003ca href=\"https://www.gfi.org/blog-state-of-the-industry-2020?utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_campaign=blog-state-of-the-industry-2020\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopped\u003c/a\u003e 2019’s \u003cem\u003etotal\u003c/em\u003e fundraising haul (yes, including Beyond Meat’s $250 million IPO), per alt-protein lobbying firm the Good Food Institute. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlant-based meat company Impossible Foods raised $500 million, while media/alt-food brand LiveKindly pulled in $200 million. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e While some of this momentum is driven by the pandemic, a Berenberg analyst told the Financial Times that broad consumer trends toward environmentalism, healthy eating, and
